mailing-address.narrative: R.G. Casey Building, John McEwen Crescent, Barton ACT 0221, Australia

organisation.narrative: Australia - Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade

description.narrative: WFP is appealing for funds under the Pacific Humanitarian Team COVID-19 Response Plan, including on food security. COVID-19 is exacerbating food insecurity in the Pacific through supply chain disruptions and the impact of government imposed movement restrictions. A first order priority is to understand the food security and economic impacts of the COVID-19 crisis. Australia is funding WFP AUD 1 million to rollout rapid food security assessments across the Pacific, including Fiji, Vanuatu, Solomon Islands, Tonga and Samoa, followed by Kiribati and Tuvalu. We will also earmark AUD 1.5 million to support WFP’s operations in Myanmar, a priority country under the Global COVID-19 Humanitarian Response Plan. Funds will help WFP provide life-saving assistance to those whose access to livelihood opportunities have been dramatically curtailed by movement restrictions imposed due to COVID-19. The total estimated value of this investment is AUD 2.5 million to be expensed in 2019-20 FY.

participating-org.narrative: Australia - Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade
